Comments_List: I've learnt a lot about oil painting techniques and materials, history of painting, and how paintings age and are preserved.
Great way to get a better understanding of painting methods and materials, as advertised.

I learned a great deal about how to observe a painting and understand the process behind its creation.  Among other specific skills, I learned how Old Master Painters mixed their gesso, how they created skin tones using paint, and how they utilized layers to create their final products.  Perhaps most importantly, though, I learned how to be patient both with material and with myself.

I think that I learned a lot about oil paint as a medium. I learned how oil paint can behave when you add more or less solvent or medium. I also learned about the history of the medium. Mark is a great teacher, and he has a wide range of knowledge about the subject that he is teaching.
Maybe we can have some in-class sketch sessions outside of drawing studio and inside the museums, that way we can draw together as a class and develop observation skills.
It covers a lot of material and has interesting assignments but could benefit from more time spent painting during the class.
I thought that the course was great because I learned a lot about painting techniques. I'd like it more if we actually painted more in class and spent less time on writing.

Yes, it's a super fun and diverse class. It truly demonstrates that everyone is born as a painter and it's really helpful to learn and paint with students from all academic backgrounds. The range of painting techniques, drawing materials and subject matters is very enriching.
There is no one better to learn from than Mark.
I would recommend this course to a second semester senior who has finished all of their other credits.  I would recommend taking this class Credit/D/Fail.
